5 cm materials needed  4 mm g size hook  approx 55-60 grams 110-120 metres / 120-131 yards of any 100% cotton dk yarn desired i used oxford yarns eco cotton in light blue color 1 and in white color 2  yarn needle for weaving in ends  scissors k a m e crochet designs 2019 by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer all rights reserved stitches used and abbreviations magic_ring = magic_ring chain = chain skip = skip st/sts= stitch/ stitches slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet bpsc = back post single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet bphdc = back post half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet treble_crochet = treble_crochet puff st = puff *-* =repeat pattern between these symbols special stitches front post double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the front around the post of given stitch from right to left yarn over and finish your double_crochet as usual back post single_crochet insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your single crochet as usual back post half_double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your half_double_crochet as usual back post double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your double_crochet as usual k a m e crochet designs 2019 by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer all rights reserved puff yarn over hook insert hook in indicated stitch/space pull up a long loop through that stitch/space 3 loops on hook yarn over hook again and insert hook into the same stitch/space pull up a loop same height as the previous one 3 more times you should have 9 loops on your hook yarn over and pull through all 9 loops on your hook chain 1 to close the puff gauge 4 double_crochet and 3 row = 1 additional notes  us terms used throughout  each round starts with a chain 1 2 or 3 these are not counted as a stitch unless instructed otherwise  if your washcloth is wavy a bit after you completed it i advise to lightly block it to stop curling to start magic_ring round 1 chain 3 double_crochet 12 into the ring join with a slip_stitch to first double_crochet not chain 3 12 double_crochet round 2 chain 2 1 double_crochet in same st fpdc around the chain 3 from previous round and the same st you just put a double_crochet into *1dc in next
